svcsubproc.title: Street Side Stop Signs
svcsubproc.para: To remove street side stop signs located on the side of the bus body below driver side window, or the optional rear driver side body mounted stop arm or sign, follow the procedure as described. Stop sign lights may vary according to the requirements as specified by the municipality or school district. The optional lights may be either strobe or L.E.D. type.

step1.para: If only replacement bulbs are needed in the stop arm sign, the lens should be removed and bulb replaced. Replace bulbs with the proper style and bulb designation as required by the manufacturer.
To remove the entire stop arm assembly, locate the two front mounting screws on the swing arm bracket.

figure.caption: Figure 189. Stop Arm Assembly Front Mounting Screws

step1.para: Loosen and remove the lower screw, then loosen the upper screw.
Disconnect cable pull on the sign assembly and remove the cotter pin.
Swing the sign to the open position. Locate the rear mounting screws on the swing sign assembly.
Loosen the upper and lower screws, then remove the lower screws.

figure.caption: Figure 190. Rear Stop Arm Mounting Screws (Optional Sign Assembly)

step1.para: With an assistant holding the assembly, remove the upper mounting screws.
Disconnect the stop sign / arm assembly harness plug and remove the stop sign / arm assembly.
